revised_title: Application of Kinetic Theory to Electric, Magnetic, and Optical Properties of Diatomic Gases
tldr: This paper applies the Boltzmann-Maxwell Kinetic Theory of Gases to the electric, magnetic, and optical properties of diatomic gases, such as hydrogen and oxygen. The author calculates the magnetic susceptibility, dielectric constant, and electrical conductivity, and discusses the optical control, dispersion, and polarization effects. The results are compared to experimental observations and other theories.
